name: Calypso Orchid
climate: Calypso Orchid thrives in cool, temperate climates with moist conditions.
The plant prefers regions where humidity is high throughout the year.
Calypso Orchid is found in climates with steady rainfall and no extreme heat.
The orchid often grows in forested areas where the climate is stable.
sunlight: Calypso Orchid prefers dappled sunlight filtered through forest canopies.
Direct sunlight is harmful; it thrives best under shade conditions.
Optimal growth is achieved with indirect sunlight in cool areas.
The orchid grows well in low-light environments under tree cover.
watering: The Calypso Orchid requires consistent moisture in the soil without waterlogging.
Water regularly to keep the soil damp, simulating its natural damp habitat.
Avoid excess water as it causes root rot; let soil dry slightly between waterings.
A balanced approach to watering ensures the orchid does not dry out completely.
soil: Soil should be rich in organic matter and retain moisture efficiently.
Loose, well-draining soil is critical to prevent waterlogged conditions.
Natural forest litter provides an ideal nutrient-rich soil composition.
Soil pH should be slightly acidic to neutral for optimal orchid health.
extra_care_tip: Avoid disturbing the plant's roots as it is very sensitive to disturbance.
Do not transplant often, as the orchid may not survive the stress.
Ensure the habitat mimics natural conditions, with humid and cool settings.
